title: Energy Analyst and Energy Trader
description: Country Greece City ATHENS Workplace location SITE-EXTERNE(GRC) Employer company RENOPTIPOWER S.A Domain Sales Type of contract Regular position Experience Minimum 3 years Context & Environment We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Energy Analyst and Energy Trader, as a free-lancer with full commitment, to join our team at RenoptiPower SA, a dynamic Renewable Energy Sources (RES) aggregator. This hybrid role involves a mix of data analysis, market research, and active trading to optimize our energy assets. You will play a key role in shaping the future of our energy trading strategies and contribute to the growth of our RES portfolio. Activities Responsibilities:• Analyze large and complex data sets, applying statistical methods to derive insights. • Conduct market research and provide in-depth market analysis for strategic decision-making. • Develop, implement, and maintain models to optimize energy trading strategies. • Collaborate with traders and stakeholders to ensure efficient execution of energy trades and risk management. • Work closely with energy research team, contributing to the development of energy market fundamentals models. • Follow up of energy regulations and market developments. • Achieve operationally profit trading shifts. Candidate Profile Qualifications:• Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering (preferred), or related field. • EnEx Certificate of electricity spot markets (DAM &IDM). • 2+ years of experience in energy trading. • Strong analytical skills, proficiency in statistical modeling, and ability to interpret large datasets. • Knowledge of energy trading strategies, hedging techniques, and market dynamics. • Experience in power markets, natural gas, and/or crude oil markets is preferred. • Advanced proficiency in Excel and at least one programming language such as Python, R (no VBA needed). • Excellent written and communication skills. • Ability to work independently and collaboratively within cross-functional teams. • Strong attention to detail, multitasking ability, and working under tight deadlines. • A Master's degree in a relevant field is a plus. Additional Information Offered: • Competitive remuneration package. • Group Health Insurance program. • Inclusive working environment. • Continuous training and participation in development activities. • Opportunities for career growth and advancement. • Contribution to shaping the future of renewable energy. TotalEnergies values diversity, promotes individual growth and offers equal opportunity careers.

title: Energy Market Trader & Scheduler
description:
Energy Market Trader & Scheduler (Attica)

The world of energy is constantly growing and evolving! At PPC (Public Power Corporation), we are looking for people with enthusiasm, knowledge, and positive energy, who want to take their careers one step further. With a team spirit, trust, and empathy, we strive to create a work environment with equal opportunities and respect for everyone, without discrimination.

If you are interested in your personal and professional development in an environment with a pleasant atmosphere and favorable benefits, we invite you to submit your application today. Your future is here!

Find your place in the world of energy. Apply now!

Responsibilities:
• Ensures the participation of PPC S.A. and their subsidiaries in the Greek short-term energy wholesale electricity markets of the Interconnected System (or other countries in which the company operates, if required), as well as in the corresponding markets of the Non-Interconnected Islands, where they exist, in accordance with the timings and all kinds of relevant provisions and regulations of the Markets based on the predefined strategy
• Establishes the procedures that ensure the proper operation of the daily shift of short-term markets and prepares reports on the efficiency of those procedures
• Communicates with relevant business levels of the company to collect required data for the preparation of offers in the relevant short-term markets
• Implements projects of the Department, participates actively in the testing of new systems and contributes to the consultation procedure on regulatory issues of energy market
• Plans the operation of energy portfolios on a short-term rolling basis horizon (D-2, D-1) based on market simulations

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
• Master’s degree related to Energy Markets will be considered an additional qualification
• At least two (2) years of relevant experience in managing distributed portfolios
• Experience in an energy management and/or energy trading company will be considered an additional qualification
• Certification as an Energy Trader in short-term electricity markets
• Certification as an Energy Trader in energy futures will be considered an additional qualification
• Knowledge of Power Automate and/or Power BI and/or Python will be considered an additional qualification
• Good knowledge of the English language
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Internet

Competencies:
• Accountability and result orientation
• Teamwork and collaboration
• Negotiation and influence
• Customer orientation
• Personal development
• Understanding of business environment
• Adaptability

Benefits:
• Inclusive working environment
• Continuous training and participation in development activities
• Group health and life insurance program
• Reduced electricity consumption invoice

title: Energy Market Trader & Scheduler
description: Η εταιρία ΔΕΗ Α.Ε προσφέρει θέση εργασίας Energy Market Trader & Scheduler

title: Claims and Demurrage Officer
description:
About the company

BB Energy operates across the globe and is among the world’s leading independent trading companies – applying our depth of experience to oil refining, logistics, storage and financing.

At BB Energy we are constantly evolving in order to meet new challenges, while developing our personnel to ensure a competitive edge.

Our global trading offices are staffed by experienced traders who count Gas, Crude Oil, Light and Middle Distillates, as well as Bitumen, as their specialties. The traders are supported by skilled shipping and financial operations personnel, headquartered in Athens.

Main Responsibilities
• Checking and handling of Owners’ and trading partners’ demurrage claims, freight invoices and other shipping costs and ensure same are recharged to our counterparties fully documented within the time bar limits
• Analyze Contracts, Charter-parties and voyage documents, clarify events with Agents, Masters, Brokers, Operators and Charterers and calculate demurrage
• Negotiate with customers the demurrage and the other shipping claims, invoice customers and pursue for payment and in disputes or non-fulfilment of payment take and follow advice from the Legal
• Keep accurate records, produce periodical and ad hoc reports and identify key trends to reduce the overall demurrage exposure of the company
• Develop and maintain good relationships with the traders, operators and BB Energy’s chartering broker
• Provide commercial support, analytical assessment, identify issues and propose solutions to Trading, Chartering, Operations and Risk departments
• Occasional travel required

Desired skills and experience
• Relevant experience of minimum 3-5 years in a petroleum trading company or in the demurrage department of a tanker ship management company
• Experience with tankers and barges are essential
• Bachelor’s or higher degree – preferably in Law/Shipping
• Competent in day to day correspondence
• Excellent written and spoken English
• Effective written and verbal communication with different departments
• Strong negotiation skills
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Good understanding of contracts, charter-parties and key laytime/demurrage provisions and the terminology associated with the petroleum industry commodities.
• Strong facilitation, planning, organizational, analytical and teamwork skills.
• Computer Literate in Microsoft Suite, experience in commercial systems and ability to learn new ones
• Proactive and able to work on own initiative
• Proven ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines

title: Energy Trader
description:
# One Group | One Power

ELPEDISON is the first independent energy utility in Greece, and a leader in providing outstanding and innovative energy solutions. We operate with enthusiasm in what we do and we pride ourselves of offering our employees a place where they can excel, creating value. We are offering now a set of exciting positions in our headquarters in Athens, to incite our new digital transformation program. If you are skilled in data management, data science, advanced analytics, technology project management, or related fields, this can be a big opportunity for YOUR career.

ELPEDISON, with its two privately-owned power plants in Thisvi (Voiotia) and Thessaloniki, with a total installed capacity of 820 MW, uses natural gas as fuel and ensures a clean and continuous electricity flow, based on a highly environmentally-friendly power generation process.

We are currently looking for an Energy Trader to be responsible for managing and optimizing energy trading positions in various markets and energy commodities to ensure profitability. The role involves making informed trading decisions in the short and medium term based on market trends, forecasts, and analysis of energy commodities such as power, gas, and EUAs. As part of the responsibilities, the candidate will model energy markets and analyze data in order to identify, implement and continuously improve trading strategies.

What will you do:
• Model energy markets and perform quantitative analysis in order to identify trading strategies in various energy commodities.
• Track market fundamentals, including generation capacity, fuel prices, weather, and policy developments in South-East Europe.
• Use technical analysis, quantitative models, and market intelligence to discover trends and patterns in various energy commodities.
• Develop analytic tools to facilitate operations and improve trading algorithms.
• Participate in cross border physical transmission rights’ auctions between countries.
• Engage with counterparties, brokers, and market participants to negotiate, settle trades and review contractual process.
• Maintain accurate records of all trades and positions for internal reporting and regulatory compliance.
• Provide regular updates and reports to senior management on market developments, trading performance, and strategies.
• Regularly interact with teams internally to discuss strategies, business implications, and market movements.

What you need to be successful:
• A BSc in Engineering or Mathematics
• At least 2 years experience in the modelling of energy sector and 1 year in technical analysis
• Knowledge of energy market simulation software (Plexos, EPSI) and R/Python programming strongly preferred
• Good understanding of energy markets
• Novelty seeking mind-set
• Strong energy modelling, quantitative and analytic skills
• Self-driven and motivated
• Experience in technical analysis
• Ability to communicate effectively across multiple teams and functions

Our offer to you:
• Competitive salary
• Performance-based variable pay 💰
• Ticket restaurant card 💳
• Transportation reimbursement ⛽
• Private Health Insurance coverage 🩺
• Pension Scheme
• Home electricity and natural gas discount ⚡
• Continuous learning & upskilling opportunities and access to our premium online training platform 📚
• Hybrid Working
• One extra day of paid time off
• Reimbursement for your athletic activities 🥈
• Unlimited fruits and snacks at the office 🥜

Elpedison S.A. will keep your personal information for a period of 2 years from the submission date, after which we will delete your personal data. Elpedison S.A. has the right to transfer your personal information to third parties to whom it has assigned services, which require the collection and processing of such personal data for candidate evaluation in the process of personnel selection.

For more information regarding the processing of your personal information and exercising your rights, please read the ELPEDISON Privacy Policy.

title: Power Generation Analyst/Trader
company_name: ΟΜΙΛΟΣ ΓΕΚ ΤΕΡΝΑ / GEK TERNA GROUP
description:
Η ΗΡΩΝ ΕΝΕΡΓΕΙΑΚΗ Α.Ε. εταιρεία του Ομίλου ΓΕΚ ΤΕΡΝΑ, αναζητά Power Generation Analyst/Trader

Κύριες Αρμοδιότητες:
• Aναλύει τα δεδομένα αγοράς και παραγωγής ηλεκτρικής ενέργειας, βελτιστοποιώντας τις στρατηγικές αγοράς και πώλησης
• Αναλύει και προβλέπει τις τάσεις τιμών στις Ελληνικές χονδρεμπορικές αγορές ηλεκτρικής ενέργειας,
• Συνεργάζεται με την Ομάδα Παραγωγής Ενέργειας για τη βελτιστοποίηση των οικονομικών αποτελεσμάτων του σταθμού μέσω συμμετοχής στις αγορές Target Model (DAM, IDAs, XBID, RTBEM).
• Διασφαλίζει τη συνεχή συμμετοχή στην αγορά, εκτελώντας κυλιόμενες βάρδιες.
• Συμβάλλει στην ανάπτυξη και βελτίωση αναλυτικών εργαλείων για την υποστήριξη των καθημερινών λειτουργιών και τη λήψη αποφάσεων.
• Συντάσσει αναφορές και αναλύει τον ανταγωνισμό, παρέχοντας χρήσιμες πληροφορίες στη Διοίκηση για τον στρατηγικό σχεδιασμό και την αξιολόγηση της απόδοσης.
• Παρακολουθεί την απόδοση του σταθμού μέσω ανάλυσης δεδομένων, εντοπίζοντας ευκαιρίες βελτίωσης της αποδοτικότητας και κερδοφορίας.
• Διαχειρίζεται τη στρατηγική προσφορών, εφαρμόζοντας βέλτιστες πρακτικές για την ενίσχυση της λειτουργικής αποδοτικότητας και της κερδοφορίας του θερμικού σταθμού παραγωγής ενέργειας.

Απαιτούμενα Προσόντα:
• Πτυχίο Ηλεκτρολόγου Μηχανικού, άλλων κλάδων Μηχανικής ή Φυσικών/Υπολογιστικών Επιστημών.
• Μεταπτυχιακός τίτλος σπουδών σε Ενέργεια, Ανάλυση Δεδομένων ή Data Science είναι επιθυμητός.
• Πιστοποιητικό Ενεργειακού Εμπόρου από τον EnEx θα θεωρηθεί πρόσθετο προσόν.
• 3 έτη εμπειρία σε αντίστοιχο ρόλο
• Αποδεδειγμένη γνώση και κατανόηση των Ενεργειακών Αγορών.
• Άριστη γνώση Αγγλικών & Ελληνικών (σε γραπτό και προφορικό λόγο)
• Εξοικείωση με γλώσσες προγραμματισμού, όπως VBA και Python.

Δεξιότητες
• Ισχυρές δεξιότητες ανάλυσης δεδομένων
• Ικανότητα επίλυσης σύνθετων προβλημάτων
• Άριστη ικανότητα συνεργασίας σε ομάδα
• Ικανότητα διαχείρισης αρμοδιοτήτων
• Ικανότητα αποτελεσματικής κατανομής εργασιών

title: Marketplace Manager- Energy Trading (m/f/d)
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Europe

enmacc is Europe’s largest over-the-counter trading market venue for energy and environmental commodities. Our cutting-edge platform digitalises the energy trading landscape, addressing the long-standing challenges that traders have faced for decades.

Our trading platform allows market participants to execute trades with unparalleled speed, efficiency, and security. We have over 570 companies and 2200 members trading electricity, gas, Guarantees of Origin, emissions allowances and weather derivatives. Our platform attracts a vibrant network of energy suppliers, trading houses, industrial companies, and municipal utilities. By joining our platform, participants gain access to more market opportunities, boosted liquidity, and are empowered to accelerate the energy transition.

Since 2016 we have now a dedicated team of 90 talented individuals spread across Europe. We are driven by our enthusiasm for the energy sector and technology, thriving in a dynamic scale-up environment. If you share our zeal for working in a diverse, inclusive, and fast-paced environment, we invite you to submit your application below.

Your Mission:

Join the success story of the enmacc network and its member companies to leave your mark in re-defining how energy traders work!

Your mission is to create trading success with and for the traders. Your role is to engage and grow the network of traders on enmacc contributing strongly to our goal to play an essential role on every traders desk. You will enable traders to benefit from the huge direct network and from the efficiency of the RFQ trading platform to further grow the liquidity for them. You will ensure traders get the best out of the platform and its future development, while the platform supports you with the trading process itself.

What you’ll do:
• Work closely with traders to define success and help them maximise the value through engaging with the enmacc platform
• Proactively increase number of traders, pitching and giving demos of the enmacc platform
• Increase trading fee revenue (MRR) by effectively managing and growing existing client relationships
• Work closely with our Product department to contribute to the development of new features and products needed to be successful
• Tackle ad-hoc marketplace management activities and enquiries of traders
• Cooperate with Account Management & Marketing teams to encourage user activities in the marketplace

Who you are:
• You have 2 or more years experience as a broker, trader or portfolio manager in the energy, commodity or finance industry
• You thrive on pushing boundaries and you enjoy challenging the status quo to succeed
• You like to be challenged by the traders and your job, with a thirst for learning
• You are ‘hands on’: independent, entrepreneurial, and result oriented
• You like ownership and you know how to be a ferocious self-starter and a great team player

What you’ll get:
• Entrepreneurial company culture with flat hierarchies
• Competitive Remuneration Scheme
• Abroad working policy form EU and outside EU.
• Learning & Development: a Personal Development Plan along with especially allocated budget and 5 days off to further your personal & professional development
• Being part of our supportive, persistent, curious and fun culture!
• Joining a grown-up start-up in the SaaS/energy field
• Modern office spaces in the heart of Munich
• Hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine working in the office with working from home
• State of the art Apple hardware and software
• Free drinks, fruit, and coffee, special fitness offers and discount offers
• German classes
• Relocation assistance for international candidates

#LI-Remote

Got energy? Join us!
